column2: Actual Text (There will be a character limit but IDK what it is yet)
Today is a beautiful day.
I wonder what adventure awaits?

column1: Add a task bar of things to do?
column2: (Do all these tasks at least once before going to bed)
Water the plants
Read a book
Play with yarn
Visit pet rock
Drink water
Make food

column1: Task bar update after everything is finished
column2: Go to bed
This is a gate that leads to the outside. You decide you'd much rather be at home than out in the wilderness
It is scientifically proven that you are less likely to get cancer by staying away from the wilderness. Keeping that in mind, you decide to stay home.
The chances of getting hit by a meteor in the wilderness are low, but never zero. Keeping that in mind, you decide to stay home.
There is a gate blocking the way. Confused on how you are meant to overcome this obstacle, you decide to stay home instead.
You can hear the sound of faint cluckings in the distance. Confused, you decide to ignore it instead.
Would you like to water the plants?
Thanks to you, these plants manage to live yet another day
You've already watered the plants. Are you sure you want to water them again?
You water the plants again, filling the pot with water.
The pot is filled to the brim with water. You consider adding more, but that would just start flooding the house. Reluctantly, you decide to stop drowning your plants.
This is your favorite book. You have read this book 73 times in the past few weeks. Would you like to read it again?
The story happens exactly as you remembered. You struggle to recall why you even bothered with reading this. Disappointed, you put down the book and try to find something more interesting to do.
This is your favorite book. You have read this book (73+n) times in the past few weeks. Would you like to read it again?

You try to pick up your favorite book, but quite frankly, reading the same book 78 times for the past few weeks feels like a bit too much even by your standards. You put down the book and try to find something more interesting to do.
You push a ball of yarn on the floor. The ball unravels into a giant mess. You are content.

column1: Playing with ball of yarn cont
column2: You push the ball of yarn on the floor again. The ball further unravels into a giant mess. You are content.

column1: Playing with ball of yarn maxed
column2: The ball of yarn is no longer a ball and can no longer unravel. Disappointed, you decide to do something else.
This is Gerald.  If he's a good boy this week, perhaps you'll buy him a nice set of googly eyes
You tell Gerald your favorite joke. Gerald doesn't respond. Angry, you decide to give him a time out and ignore him for the time being.

column1: Interacting with the glass of water
column2: You look at the water on your nightstand.  It's gone stale

column1: Interacting with the glass of water again
column2: You're not thirsty.  Especially for stale water.  You're better than this.
You try to cook some eggs, but accidently drop them on the floor instead. Disgruntled, you clean up the mess and throw it in the trash.
You try to make more food, but drop the eggs again. You are starting to get annoyed at all the cleaning you have to do.
You drop the eggs again. You begin to wonder whether if there is something cosmically wrong with the universe as you scrub more yolk off the floor.
There are no more eggs left in the fridge. You are a disgrace.
It's still too early to go to bed. There's still so much to do!
It has been an eventful day. You decide to call it a night and go to sleep.
Think of what this means for our homes! Our family! Our children!
I beseech you my dear feline. The forest is in need of a guardian, a hero, to save us all! So what do you say, are you ready to save the world?
... snore ... snore ... CRASH! You wake up to your house shaking violently.
The house stops shaking. There are sounds of trees falling outside the door. You decide to leave the house to see what's happening.

column1: Scene with a volcano erupting in the background

column2: Good heavens! Thank goodness I've managed to find someone here! I come to you in dire straits! We are being attacked! Figments of mother nature are uniting against us and destroying the forest.
No
Sorry I don't speak chicken.

column1: Turns back to go to home

column2: WAIT! Before you head back inside -
Well that's unfortunate.

... In any case, since your home is destroyed and the forest is getting attacked, it would make sense if you want to leave the forest. The only way out of here is through the trees to the north and over a canyon to the other side. Normally, it would impossible for anyone to make it through, but luckily for you, I have a few tricks up my sleeve that can help you get safely across. But I'll only help you if you help me and my village to stop the invasion. So what do ya say? Partners?
No
Burn in hell, chicken man
Well that's just ineccesantly rude. I'll have you know that you're actually talking to Sir Cluckers the III, first of his name, heir to the Iron Coop, and ... AHH THEY'RE BACK

column1: Transition to first fight against landslide

column2: Well what are doing just standing there? Fight him!
... You do know how to fight don't you?
Because otherwise, we are both going to die!
Eyes Covered "Is it over? Did we win?"
Phew that was a close one.
Don't take this the wrong way, but you didn't exactly look like the fighting type. Glad I was wrong.
Anyways, as I was saying, the forest's pretty unstable right now, so it's probably be best if we all just leave.
Our village is getting attacked pretty badly though, so maybe we can work out some sort of deal?
Come to the village and help our people. After that I'll teach you how to get across the canyon.
Until then, toodles!
Your former home, now in complete ruin. You are inconsolable
On the bright side, at least Gerald seemed to have managed to find some new friends. Happy for him, you decide to let him start his new life.

column1: Leaves starting area to transition area

column2: A canyon separates between you and the other side of the forest. It seems to be pretty far away.  Do you want to try and jump across?
Why not?
Are you insane?

Right before you jump, you suddenly remember that you are a cat, and in fact, do not have wings. You sheepishly turn back around and decide to use one of your nine lives on something far less dangerous and stupid.
You rightfully decide that this is a dumb idea. Turning around, you decide to do something more productive instead.
Wonderful, you came! Looks like you're the hero this forest needs after all!
As you can see things aren't really looking that great so far.
Maybe to start, you can help by defending some of the chickens being attacked by spirits.
After that, maybe we'll find a way to stop all these spirits from attacking our village once and for all.
So onwards my wingless steed! Let's show what these spirits we're made of!
Defend the chickens!
Help us!
My feathers!
This is an unethical farming practice!
Eek! Fire on my wings!

Nice! Those spirits didn't stand a chance. You're pretty good at this whole fighting thing y'know. Maybe if you change your mind about leaving the forest, you can come back and be our royal COOPeral. Squawk!

Anyways, I'm sure everyone here is greatful for our valiant effort.  Why not have a gander around town?  I'm sure everyone is greatful for our hard work.  Once you're done, let me know.  There's one more favor I need to ask.
Done looking around town?  Egg-cellent!  Now, what I wanted to discuss was--

column1: Aeolus Appears, screen darkens, wind gusts float across the screen. Sound effects

column2: Oh no!
He's here!
What have you done with my children, Cluck.
I-it's wasn't me!  Th-the Feline--
I will not fall for your tricks again, Chicken. You will pay for what you have done to my family
Aeolus summons cage to fall on top of Cluck, capturing him
What... is the meaning of this? Do you know who you're talking to? I am Sir Cluckers the III, first of his name, Prince of the Golden Yolks, Master of -
Silence. I grow tired of your voice.
I recognize you, Feline.
It is rather unusual for your kind to show up so deep in the forest.
Regardless, if you know what's best for you, you'll leave the village right now.
Good day.
Save me my steedddddd...
Aeolus Flies away with Cluck.

Oh Sir Cluckers got abducted? Yeah that happens from time to time. Don't let that bother you too much though, but if you  really want to save him, you should go to the canyon area right now. He's probably being held captive over there.
What does the C in KFC stand for?
Who knows! But whatever it is, I hope it isn't chicken!
Are they here to help?
What is a cat going to do against that spirit?
I'm going to stay cooped up inside. Let me know when it's over.
column4: Too many NPCs, maybe remove these lines?

column2: You couldn't have brought a Lion Cluck? How is a housecat going to help?
A CAT? In Chickentown? Who thought this was a good idea?
The elementals are running crazy!  Even my strongest wind spell can't control them!

column1: Chicken village NPC 7 (beside water elemental battle)
column2: Everyone's complaining about all the elementals running around, but I like to look on the bright side.  Mom hasn't made me shower in days!
Eat Mor Cowz
*Sniffle* They grow up so fast...
The egg shimmers with independence and ambition.
To be honest, I'm kinda glad the chicken village is getting attacked. I was supposed to have an exam today, but it got cancelled after a fire spirit set Mrs. Bok on fire.
Are you an egg-orcist?
All these clucking spirits attacking our clucking village and leaves me to clean up all the mess. But does anyone care about Mr Cooper? Of course not!
The door to the coop is locked.
You might be wondering, why are none of the chickens hiding inside?
Truth is, all the doors to our coops have door knobs, and well, we don't have any hands to turn them.
Theoretically, you could help us with that, but unfortunately all of the doors are locked and we've lost the keys.
One of the chicken guards dropped them on the floor one day, and was never able to pick them back up.
It's not all that bad though. I actually enjoy living in the outside world.
It'd be nice to sleep on a sack of hay instead of the grass though.
SQUWAK. LET YOU INSIDE MY HOME? NEVER! GET YOUR FILTHY PAWS OFF MY PROPERTY.
Darla's always been awfully protective of her coop.
Which is weird because the coop's empty and we've never even been inside.
I guess our wings are just not built for doorknob opening.
Whoever built this place clearly didn't know anything about chickens.
No one remembers who used to live here.  Some say he was the only one who never left since The Dropping of the Keys.
I, for one, think he flew the coop.
Seeds! Seeds! Freshly plucked from the ground! Buy your food or sign up for a meal plan here today!
Everyone's been flocking to Pao over there. What am I gonna tell my wife?
Five bawks? Five bawks?
No! Seven bawks!
There is a sign next to the baskets of seeds. It reads: The Chicken Farm Summer Sale. Seven bucks per bag!
The seed market is my favorite place to visit out of the entire village. Would be cool if they also made a worm market here as well, but hey, as they say, peckers can't be choosers, right?
The landscaping here is impeckable.
The haystack looks warm and comfotable.  Take a rest?
You were just beginning to relax when a needle poked you in the back.  What are the odds?
You bow your head in respect.

column1: Fight waves (a few) of spirits in transition area, until the canyon area is reached. Aeolus is standing over the canyon, with Cluck trapped next to him in a cage.
Ground constantly shaking, meteors falling --> visual emphasis of unstable

column2: I see you have refused to listen to my advice.
It's funny now that I think about it.
My whole life, I always imagined that it was possible to create a world where spirits and animals could live and coexist in harmony and stability.
I'm sure you still remember those days, don't you?
It felt like merely months ago when all of this was still true.
But what I've come to realize these past few years is that power can corrupt even the noblest and most pure of heart.
All it takes is a little push, and the world delves into chaos and unstableness you're witnessing here today.
But none of that matters anymore.
My children, my brethen that your kind have murdered, captured and tortured.
Their blood is on your hands!
No... this cannot be...
Ha! Suck on that you windy clucker! Go on, finish him off! I knew you always had it in you!
Do what you must.
What do you do?
Kill Aeolus
column3: If choose this path, Aeolus dissolves,  Neko pushes cage over releasing Cluck

column2: Push Sir Cluckers III
column3: Neko pushes Cluck in cage over the edge

column2: Pfft. What a melodramatic clucker.
Well anyways, good job! You've managed to save me!
As promised here is your reward!
Player received... chicken wings?
With that you'll be able to make it across the other side of the canyon.
What's that?
You want to know what the favor I was originally gonna ask you?
No need to worry your little whiskers over that, because that problem has already been taken care of!
I'll see you around my feline friend.
Toodles!
The strong hum of wind under your paws terrify you, but somehow, the wings Sir Cluckers gave you seem to suggest that everything is going to be okay. Do you want to jump over?
Yes
No
The wings allowed you to glide over the canyon.
Haha yeah, let's go [player name], we've won! Now we can celebr -
Wait, what are you doing?
Wait, no, stop, listen to me.
You're making a mistake.
Wait!
Cluck gets pushed off
That was... a pleasant surprise.
I don't understand what the reasoning behind what you did is, but I'm thankful that you ended up making it.
Perhaps I was wrong to have judged all of your kind the same way.
You need to make it to the other side of the canyon?
That could be easily arranged.
Player received "Blessing of the Winds"!
This should help you get across.
Aeolus prepares to leave.
I won't forget what you have done for me today, cat.
Until our paths cross again.
Aeolus flies away
The winds howling over the canyon bends under your control under the blessing of the wind. Would you like to fly over?
Yes
No
You fly over the canyon.
*Smells like fried chicken.
"Glad I'm not on the menu!"
"So many burning questions..."
"I'm too young to fry!"
*Smells like ground chicken
"Who's the real Dirty Dan?"
"You're gonna need a bath after this"
"It's my bEARTHday next week!"
*Cluck's feathers are ruffled.
"Flock off, feather face."
"I wish I could fly, like really fly. Not just two feet"
Why did the tornado take a break? Because it got winded!
What is the wind's favorite color? Blew!
Which day of the week has the most powerful wind? Wind-sday!
*Your fur stands on end.
"What a shocking turn of events!"
"You're conducting yourself rather well."
"I was confused how to best trounce these elementals... Then it struck me!"
"Who was that guy? You know? With the hammer? It'll come back to me later..."
*The air is thick with humidity.
"I'm not in the mood for a birdbath..."
"You can run, but you can't tide!"
"I make water puns for the halibut!"
"Water you looking at?"
"Beach Day?"
"Let that be a lesson to you!"
"Shows you right, rebelling against Sir Cluckers III!"
"And dust to dust."
"They never stood a chance against us!"
"And stay down!"
"Fierce, like a tiger? No, a Lion. Sorry, you get what I'm trying to say."

column1: Cluck's Comments: post battle low health #1
column2: "You had me worried there for a moment."

column1: Cluck's Comments: post battle low health #2
column2: "Perhaps play it safer, next time?"
"Didn't waste any of your lives did you? Please tell me you still have more than five."

column6: "So even my strongest allies could not detain you..."
"Fine then, feign your ignorance.  It matters little now that I have escaped your captivity!  Begone!"

column2: Bella make NPC
column6: "Still here?  My, how powerful you're beginning to grow.  Such a shame that I can't permit you to live long enough to fully embrace your full potential."
"Dark winds blow ahead.  Know your place and kneel before Aeolus, Master of the Wind!"
"When I'm done with you, your chicken friends are next!"
"How long will you be able to withstand?"
"My tempest is not so easily quelled!"
"You cannot exorcise my winds of change!"
"As sure as the wind blows, you will not stop me!"
*The wind chills you to the bone.
*In the distance, you can still hear Cluck's squawking.
"Impossible... Even again such weak magic... I've been defeated...?"
